course.subject: CHEM
course.name: General Chemistry IA
course.description: This course is an introduction to fundamental principles of chemistry for students who have learnt the basic knowledge of chemistry in high school. Topics include atomic structure and periodicity, chemical bonding and molecular structure, basic properties of gases, liquids and solids, chemical kinetics, chemical equilibrium, and basic organic and biological molecules.
course.prerequisites: Level 3 or above in HKDSE 1/2x Chemistry OR CHEM 1004
course.exclusions: Level 3 or above in HKDSE 1x Chemistry, CHEM 1008, CHEM 1020

reviews.author: std
reviews.title: Review for those who have studied physics and chemistry in high school
reviews.comment_content:
Textbook: AE Chemistry: An Atoms First Approach (2nd Edition/ 3rd Asian Edition)

***A detailed syllabus made by myself is attached for your reference.

Comparison between CHEM1010 and CHEM1020:
CHEM1010 Covers chapter 1-8 of the textbook in this semester
CHEM1020 Covers chapter 1-9 of the textbook (according to some reviews in  USTSPACE)
According to some reviews in  USTSPACE, in ch.1-8, most of the content is the same in the two courses, but some topics are not taught in CHEM1010.
Normally, you cannot choose whether to enroll in CHEM1010 or CHEM1020

Over half of the topics in this course are basically a review of high school physics and chemistry, but they are taught in a more systematic and rigorous way. Some topics may be new to you (eg. quantum mechanics, ch.2, molecular orbital model, dsp3, ch.4), these topics will usually account for a higher percentage in exams. Some topics are easier than high school chemistry (eg. chemical energy, ch.7)

If you studied chemistry and physics in high school, you cannot learn many new things in this course.

Midterm: 45 MCQ, no difficult calculations, no calculators
Ch1: 30%
Ch2: 50%
Ch3: 20%

Final: 50% MCQ, 50% fill in the blanks + long questions + Q&A + ... , you should bring a simple scientific calculator
Ch3: 10%
Ch4: 50%
Ch5: 10%
Ch6: 10%
Ch7: 10%
Ch8: 10%
reviews.comment_teaching:
Face-to-face lectures & Real-time Zoom Meetings

It may seem that the teaching speed is very slow and it is very easy for you to understand everything during the lecture, but it may turned out that there are a lot to study at the end.

PowerPoint slides are uploaded to Canvas before lectures.

The professor's English was very easy to understand. You could ask her question after class in English or Cantonese, but you were not allowed to ask her questions in Cantonese in class in order to be fair to everyone.

There was a 30 minute tutorial taught by a TA before the final exam. Some basic sample questions were provided. The time was very limited and I don't think it is very helpful.

There were special office hours before the exams for students to ask questions.

You could check you paper after the exams but you could neither take photos nor take your paper away.

Not many people attended the lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
Remember to write down as many steps as you can or marks may be deducted. Using the professor's way of solving may be better.

The professor said that mean = C+ to B-, if you are slightly above mean, it will be B.

It is not difficult to get a good grade as long as you have fair chemistry and physics foundation.

Midterm 50% (distribution attached below)
Average Score is 27.1/45 (60.2%) ; St. dev. = 8.4 ; Max = 44 ; Min = 7

Final 50% (distribution attached below)
Average = 49.1 / 100 ;  Stdev = 20.6 ; Max = 94 ; Min = 15.5
reviews.comment_workload:
Reading assignments and suggested end-of chapter questions are given at the end of each chapter, the professor said that exam questions would be similar to the suggested end-of-chapter questions.

I think that the reading assignments and suggested end-of chapter question are not necessary as long as you fully understand the content in the PowerPoint slides. However, if you did not learn them before, you should practise doing the questions on that topic.

There were around 40-60 questions for each chapter.

You may need to spend several days to revise for your exams:
Midterm 27th Oct: 250 Powerpoint slides
Final 13th Dec: 312 Powerpoint slides

reviews.author: KIKC
reviews.comment_content:
The contents are quite easy.

Chapter 1: Chemical Foundations
Chapter 2: Atomic Structure and Periodicity
Chapter 3: Bonding-General Concepts
Chapter 4: Molecular Structure and Orbitals
Chapter 5: Stoichiometry
Chapter 6:Types of Chemical Reactions and Solution Stoichiometry
Chapter 7: Chemical Energy
Chapter 8: Gases

Due to the time-limit, chapter 8 has not covered in this semester.
reviews.comment_teaching: Emily is the best professor in UST I have met. She explained all concepts clearly. Her notes were well-organised and very easy to understand. During the class, if you had any questions,   you could ask her immediately and she would explain it again. If you had any questions after the class, you could also ask her through email or zoom. If you were not good at English, she felt free to speak Cantonese to answer your questions. :)
reviews.comment_grading:
Online quizzes: 20%
midterm: 40%
final: 40%

For my case,
Online quiz 1: 19.5/25 (mean:18.8)
Online quiz: 34/40 (mean: 22.4)
midterm: 39/50 (mean: 30.1)
final: 66.5/100 (mean: 52.2, SD: 15.7)
Final grade: A-

The grade is quite good. I have not expected I can get A range because I get C range of CHEM1004. :)
reviews.comment_workload: One midterm, one final and two quizzes. The workload is not quite heavy.

reviews.author: HKUST-1
reviews.title: A fair course in both grading and content
reviews.comment_content:
This semester is online teaching mode.

Chapter Review: Measurement and Calculations in Chemistry Chapter 1: Chemical Foundations
Chapter 2*: Atomic Structure and Periodicity
Chapter 3: Bonding -General Concepts
Chapter 4:*Molecular Structure and Orbitals
Chapter 5: Stoichiometry
Chapter 6: Types of Chemical Reactions and Solution Stoichiometry
Chapter 7: Chemical Energy

Originally 8 chapters will be covered, but due to not enough time, only 1-6 and a few slides of chapter 7 is covered in midterm+ final exam.

2 online quiz, 1 mid term, 1 final

A easier course compared to chem1020, using the same textbook but less difficult.
For those who studied chem 1004.

You don't need to remember anything from chem1004, since all of the stuff that appeared again will be taught during the lecture.

Not that hard if you do all the questions given by Emily in the book.

Practice makes perfect, got C- in 1004 and A- in 1010.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Emily, Hong Kong professor, native English speaker, you may find that her English is better than her Cantonese.

Good teaching, you will not find difficult to understand the stuff she teaches.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair grading.

Quiz 1 22.5/25, mean = 18.9

Quiz 2 31/40, mean = 27.8

Mid Term 34.5/50, mean = 26.3, sd = 7.4

Final 89.39/110, mean = 71.7, sd.= 16.2

Online Quiz 1    10%

Online Quiz 2     15%

Midterm Exam   35%

Final Exam         40%

+1 sd = A-, so it is a fair grade course.

There are still some crazy guy getting almost full score in the exam and mt, don't get scared by them, they are only just some extreme value, I totally have no idea why they can get such high score.
reviews.comment_workload:
2 quiz, 1 midterm, 1 final

workload is approaching to 0 if you don't practice the question provided.

reviews.author: DennisTheMenace
reviews.title: Content easy but bad grade course
reviews.comment_content:
The content of this course is fairly basic, everything is basic chemistry laboratory knowledge if you have attended chemistry class in high school. There was however a particular chapter that wasn't covered in my high school curriculum.

Contents:

Chapter 1: Chemical Foundation
Chapter 2: Atomic Structure and Periodicity
Chapter 3: Bonding: General Concepts
Chapter 4: Molecular Structure and Orbitals
Chapter 5: Stoichiometry
Chapter 6: Types of Chemical Reaction and Solution Stoichiometry
Chapter 7: Chemical Energy
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Tsang is a very professional lecturer, she was able to deliver the content of the course in a manner that makes learning more interesting. She has very good English so I have no problems understanding her.
reviews.comment_grading:
Course Grading

Online Quiz 1: 10%

Online Quiz 2: 10%

In-class Midterm Exam (Closed book): 40%

In-class Final Exam (Closed book): 40%

(Special Course Arrangement for FALL 2019)

Since on-campus classes and examinations for the 2nd half of the semester was cancelled, the final exam was replaced with 2 separate online quizzes. weighting of the course was adjusted to :
midterm -  55%
3 quizzes -  15% each.

Despite this course being an easy course, it isn't easy getting As. Mean is High AF. Getting all above means will land you somewhere in between A- and B-. To get an A you must consistently get close to full marks for ALL the quizzes and exams. Stressful on that part.

Quiz 1 : 22/25 - 15%
Quiz 2 : 23/25 - 15%
Quiz 3 : 22/25 - 15%
Midterm 30/40 - 55%

I admit I screwed up midterm so there's that.

Finalized Grade : B
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is light AF. No homework. 2 online quizzes. 1 midterm and 1 final exam. I should note that for FALL 2019, since on-campus classes and examinations for the 2nd half of the semester was cancelled, the final exam was replaced with 2 separate online quizzes. weighting of the course was adjusted to : midterm  : 55%
and 3 quizzes, 15% each.

reviews.author: Seohyun
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter Review - Measurement and Calculations in Chemistry
1 - Chemical Foundations
2 - Atomic Structure and Periodicity
3 - Bonding
4 - Molecular Structure and Orbitals
5 - Stoichiometry
6 - Types of Chemical Reactions and Solution Stoichiometry

Pretty easy if you did IB Chemistry (either SL or HL)
reviews.comment_teaching: Her pronunciation is very good and the voice is very clear. She brings few practice questions and goes through them every beginning of the class, which really helped me review.
reviews.comment_grading: As the course is very easy, the average grade is pretty high. Therefore, in order to get a good grade, you would have to pay extra attention to additional practice questions that she suggests to do after each class.
reviews.comment_workload: There is literally no assignments in this course. But you have to do the practice questions to keep up with the course materials in class. (Doing questions, highly suggested for exam prep)

reviews.author: Angushimhim
reviews.comment_content:
Not too difficult if you have taken chem1004
6 Chapters
Chapter 1: Chemical Foundations
Chapter 2: Atomic Structure and Periodicity
Chapter 3: Bonding: General Concepts
Chapter 4: Molecular Structure and Orbitals
Chapter 5: Stoichiometry
Chapter 6: Types of Chemical Reactions and Solution Stoichiometry
Chapter 7: Chemical Energy
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor presents the content very clearly. There will be some blanks to be filled in in-class in the ppt. So it is not a good idea to skip the classes. Also there will be some review questions at the beginning of each lecture which is good and useful.
reviews.comment_grading:
I did it very bad and got a C because I was lazy...
I think you can get a good grade easily if you really follow the learning progress strictly.
reviews.comment_workload:
No assignment
2 online quizzes
1 mt
1 final exam

2 online quizzes are not difficult and it can help you to revise the mt and the final exam

reviews.author: tdhvl
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter Review: Measurement and Calculations in Chemistry
Chapter 1: Chemical Foundations
Chapter 2: Atomic Structure and Periodicity
Chapter 3: Bonding
Chapter 4: Molecular Structure and Orbitals
Chapter 5: Stoichiometry
Chapter 6: Types of Chemical Reactions and Solution Stoichiometry
Chapter 7: Chemical Energy

The content of this course is mostly qualitative, except for the chemical energy part. Some content would be easy to understand for people who have strong physics background.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor speaks English fluently. She often explains every details and is ready to answer the questions from the students.

The professor does not provide the full lecture notes. She only gives an incomplete version which can be filled by attending the lectures and paying attention to the details. She also gives some review questions in the class which are at the same level as the questions in the examinations. By this way, she encourages the students to come to the class.
reviews.comment_grading:
It is easy to get high scores if you do all the review questions the professor gave in the class and in the book since all examinations questions are at the same level with these exercises.

This term only, the final score is calculated by: 45% quiz (3 quizzes*15%) + 55% midterm exam.

It is easy to get full or nearly full score in the quizzes. The midterm exam covers the first three chapters. The midterm statistics of this term is given in the attached file.

I guess that getting a score of around 95 will secure an A+.
reviews.comment_workload: Light. If you attend all the lessons and pay attention to the content, you can understand most of the parts and you just need little time to spend for review at home. There is no homework, only 3 quizzes, which are very easy and can be completed in a half of an hour each.

reviews.author: Squidgy
reviews.comment_content:
1. Significant figures
2. Chemical foundations
3. Atomic structure and periodicity
4. Bonding general concept
5. Molecular structure and orbitals
6. Stoichiometry
7. Types of chemical reaction and solution stoichiometry
8. Chemical Energy
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Emily is the best professor I’ve ever met in UST, she’s full of enthusiasm and teaches clearly with a comfortable proper English accent. If you have any question, just mail her and she’ll reply you as soon as possible. If you do not have a basic chemistry background, this course fits you.
reviews.comment_grading:
The original gradings:
Quiz*2 (10%*2)
Midterm (30%)
Final (50%)
Due to the closure of the school
Quiz*3 (15%*3)
Midterm (55%)
I got 37/40 on midterm
(mean 26.7, stdev 6.8)
24/25 24/25 23/25 on three quizzes
my score: A
reviews.comment_workload: Quizzes are the only online assignment, and I spent like 20 mins for each one even though the time restraint is 2 hrs . The content is easy, so you can start studying a week before exam if you are good at chemistry. The only part confused me is the molecular orbital (MO theory), so the workload is actually light.

reviews.author: Kentung
reviews.comment_content:
I think whether the content is interesting is partly associated with the teaching.
Some of the content is quite abstract.
Chapter Review: Measurement and Calculations in Chemistry
Chapter 1: Chemical Foundations
Chapter 2: Atomic Structure and Periodicity
Chapter 3: Bonding
Chapter 4: Molecular Structure and Orbitals
Chapter 5: Stoichiometry
Chapter 6: Types of Chemical Reactions and Solution Stoichiometry
Chapter 7: Chemical Energy
Chapter 8: Gases
reviews.comment_teaching:
Her explanation is clear;
English is fluent (comfortable easy to listen).
Her lecture notes are also very clear.
In the beginning of almost every lesson, she will provide the review questions with answers. But she wont put these on Canvas, saying that she want us to attend her lessons, so just take pictures at that moment. You have to take fast action otherwise you will easily miss the chance of taking the picture of some questions.
Yet, her lessons are worth attending.
reviews.comment_grading:
I got over 80% in mid-term and final exam but got only about 60% in online quiz and finally I got B+ in this course

Key to get good grade in exams:
I take notes of what she said which do not written down in the lecture note.
Listen to her lectures carefully since she explain things quite well.
And study all the review questions given. I didn't do any questions in the book (not required to buy) but studied all review questions. So according to my own experience, those review questions already allow you to get a pretty good grade in exams.
Of course, if you want to get a even better grade in exams, doing the questions in book can also help.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only 2 online quiz, 1 mid-term exam and 1 final exam.
So the workload is acceptable.

reviews.author: Alua
reviews.title: Doesn't require a lot of efforts
reviews.comment_content:
Course Outline:
Ch 1. Matter and Measurements
Ch 2. Chemical Foundations
Ch 3. Atomic Structure and Periodicity
Ch 4. Bonding: General Concepts
Ch 5. Molecular Structure and Orbitals
Ch 6. Chemical Stoichiometry
Ch 7. Chemical Reactions in Aqueous Solutions
Ch 8. Thermochemistry: Chemical Energy
Ch 9. Gases

The content is really interesting. Back in school I didn't like the chemistry, but this course helped me to look at this subject differently.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Jia is very kind. He has an accent, but you can get used to it after some time. His lecture notes are really helpful. There is even no need to read the textbook, because Prof provides a good  revision of this textbook.
reviews.comment_grading:
The mean scores are not so high (assignments are really easy, almost everyone gets a full mark).
MEAN Assignment 1 (5%): 42.3/50
MEAN Assignment 2 (5%): 42.7/50
MEAN Midterm Exam (40%): 56.8/90
MEAN Final Exam (50%): 58/100

I got 50/50 and 49/50 on assignments, 80.5 on midterm and 88.5 on final exam. So, I got A.
reviews.comment_workload: The main thing is to learn everything on the lecture notes and do the past papers. After one month I didn't attend the classes at all, because the lecture notes are really well-organized and high-quality. It took me several days before the midterm and 1 day before the final exam to learn everything.

reviews.author: Hachau
reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 1.   Introduction: Matter and Measurements
Chapter 2.   Chemical Foundations
Chapter 3.   Atomic Structure and Periodicity
Chapter 4.   Bonding: General Concepts
Chapter 5.   Molecular structure and orbitals
Chapter 6.   Chemical Stoichiometry

reviews.comment_teaching: Professor is very nice and helpful. He taught us carefully and provided review questions before starting a lesson. He was ready to answer any question we asked him.
reviews.comment_grading: It's easy to get A if you attend every lesson and study the slides carefully including REVIEW QUESTIONS.
reviews.comment_workload:
2 assignments, 1 midterm, 1 final.
Professor gave us homework in the end of each chapter for practicing but they were not graded.

reviews.author: Quyet
reviews.comment_content:
I learned much things from this course. The most important content is the Lewis structure. Everything taught in this course is general, no deep concepts are introduced. Specifically, chapters are listed beneath.
C1. Matter & Measurements
C2. Chemical Foundation
C3. Atomic Structure
C4. Bonding I
C5. Bonding II
C6. Stoichiometry
C7. Reactions in aqueous solution
C8. Thermochemistry
C9. Gases
reviews.comment_teaching: He is very kind and helpful, but his English is not good enough to gather our attention.
reviews.comment_grading: It will depend on your effort, but I am satisfied with my grade. The two assignments are quite easy, so most of the students can get more than 90% of the full mark.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not hard. When you don't have an exam or assignment, likely you can spend all your time on other courses. Otherwise, you only need one day to revise all the knowledge in this course in the case that you are not distracted.

reviews.author: FstandsforFk
reviews.title: Good grade course for Non-Jupas people
reviews.comment_content:
The teaching content is more or less as same as 1020 course. Using the same textbook as well.
Ch1. Matter & Measurements
Ch2. Chemical Foundation
Ch3. Atomic Structure
Ch4. Bonding I
Ch5. Bonding II
Ch6. Stoichiometry
Ch7. Reactions in aqueous solution
Ch8. Thermochemistry

Everything taught in this course is very general, no deep concepts are introduced.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor JIA has an accent but understandable. His teaching content is very organized and helpful. (Review + Exercise) He always laughs while watching the experiment videos lol
reviews.comment_grading:
For midterm, the mean is 56.8/90
Final: 58/100
The grading is not bad. If you attend the class/ do the after-class exercise and past paper before the exam, you can easily get a B or higher grade.
I got 70% overall. (B)
reviews.comment_workload:
Not really much. Attendance is not counted to grade, many people skipped the lecture. (It's a pretty tough 9 am Lecture)
Two assignments (5% each), midterm (40%) and final exam (50%)

reviews.author: Luke King
reviews.comment_content: The first few and last few lectures only got around 50-60 pages, and they are relatively easy. the first 1-2 lectures are just some basic knowledge. and the last 2-3 are related to physics (it is still find even you didn't learn phy before). The other are relatively difficult, sometimes you won't understand even you attend the lecture. BUT as long as you read the ppt once, you will understand what's going on.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The prof usually starts and ends the lessons with some review questions which cannot be found in both lecture notes and after lecture notes, so you better take photos.
There are some blanks in the lecture notes in the ppt for you to fill in, but actually you can find the answers in the after lecture notes, which will be release after teaching that chapter.
I won't say Prof Jia's english is good but you can still understand what he is talking about. He explain everything very clearly so i attend all his lectures even the class is in 9:00. He will also answer all your questions you asked and he is very nice.
reviews.comment_grading:
the midterm and final format is similar to the homework but the MC are quite tricky cuz it has 6 choices, some of them are like 2 of them are correct, 3 of them are correct, all of them are correct so you can guess the answer.
As long as you review all the lectures notes (and I also attend all the lectures), the you won't find the midterm and final very difficult. The final is a little more difficult than midterm but still ok.
My Grade: A-
Assignment 1&2: 46&48/50 (mean ~42)
midterm: 81.5/90 (mean 56.8)
Final: 80/100 (mean 58)
Total 86.12%
I thought I can get a higher grade, but anyway, maybe only a few % more to get and A
reviews.comment_workload:
not high, assignment is not difficult, you may find the answer from the source or online.
final and midterm just revise the notes then ok.

reviews.author: hannahchy
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter 1: Chemical Foundations (MC)
Chapter 2: Atomic Structure and Periodicity(Key chapter)
Chapter 3: Bonding: General Concepts (3.7)
------------------------------------------------------------------
Chapter 3: Bonding: General Concepts (3.8)
Chapter 4: Molecular Structure and Orbitals(Key chapter)

reviews.comment_teaching:
Lecture notes in student version updated with blanks.
You need to attend lectures in order to get the answer and review questions.

Emily is kind and her voice is good.

reviews.comment_content:
Chapter Review: Measurement and Calculations in Chemistry

reviews.comment_teaching:
Best instructor i have ever met in university of science and technology. Emily teaches every concept well and clearly. As long as you attend every lecture, you will understand the knowledge very very well.

There are some review questions in the beginning of each lesson which will not be posted on canvas
Those questions are exam-like and they help you a lot.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online Quizzes (2 x 10% each)20%
Midterm Exam40%
Final Exam40%

i study hard in both midterm and final examinations and i got an A. It's a good-grade course. Studying hard and paying full attention in the lectures are the only ways to understand the chemistry knowledge and get good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
light workload
there are some end-of-chapter exercises in textbook but they are optional.
only quizzes are required, no homework
it is a kind-hearted course

Emily 好好人，呢個sem我成個問題兒童咁，一落堂就衝出黎問野，佢都好有耐心咁答我，良師也！

reviews.author: Henry7872
reviews.comment_content:
其實同CHEM1020讀既野接近一樣，只係呢一個course係俾DSE無讀過chem既人讀。

Midterm之前會講下Atomic Orbital、History同埋簡單講下bonding，主要係背既野比較多。Midterm之後就會教唔同既Atomic Model/Orbital,Stoichiometry同埋gas，比較多計數同畫唔同既model。

如果有讀過Chem或者Physics都有會著數，部份topic可能都已經學過，e.g. Gas/Stoichiometry
reviews.comment_teaching: 教得幾清晰，同埋佢既notes都容易睇得明，即使走堂都可以跟得返。但powerpoint有D位要自己上堂既時候抄番落notes，唔會upload full version既lecture notes。每一堂都有review question同學生一齊做。唯一美中不足就係唔會upload review question上canvas，要上堂自己影低。
reviews.comment_grading:
20% Online Quiz
40% Midterm
40% Final

Online Quiz有2次，時間會係midterm同final前2星期上canvas做
Midterm 40條MC
Final一半MC，一半long question，有5分bonus 分

Midterm同Final above 1 sd, A
reviews.comment_workload: 只有兩次既Online Quiz同埋midterm,final exam，無hw，無project

reviews.author: cheong
reviews.title: 誠心推薦
reviews.comment_content:
其實好基本簡單，成個COURSE都係探討ATOM既MODEL，記得唔好死背，基本上了解左PHYSICS上的F＝k(Qq/r^2)呢條式，所有野都可以即時推理出來，而非留於死背。
另外唔會好似中學chem咁背無聊野，例如邊D可以防生銹之類，好講求有無真係了解曬所有原理，如果係記性差但理解能力強，好建議reg。
reviews.comment_teaching: 其實都幾好，唔會成堂讀POWERPOINT，會同我地一齊做下習題，落堂後都會細心解答問題，臨考試前會俾份powerpoint話俾我地知邊個topic要特別溫熟
reviews.comment_grading: 極好，一係唔上堂，一上堂就傾計，居考前望下NOTE就溫完，身邊所有人包括我都A！
reviews.comment_workload:
無功課做
FINAL唔洗考番MIDTERM野，所以好快溫完了

reviews.author: jhvjhvjhv
reviews.title: CHEM1010
reviews.comment_content: Simple basic chemistry concepts are covered. ( atomic structure and periodicity, chemical bonding and molecular structure, basic properties of gases, liquids and solids, chemical kinetics, chemical equilibrium, and basic organic and biological molecules)
reviews.comment_teaching: He is one of the best professor that I ever met. His explanation is very clear and if you do not understand anything, he is willing to help you out during the office hour.
reviews.comment_grading: This course is for non-chemistry students too so the grading should be good as long as you know what is going in the class.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload. Midterm and Final exams. 50% each. Doing questions from the textbook is very helpful.

reviews.author: mll
reviews.title: Good Course
reviews.comment_content: Useful content. But most of them is the same with high school. Maybe you will find it too simple. But for students who haven't learnt chemistry, the content is just suitable.
reviews.comment_teaching: LI, Xiaoyuan is very responsible and teaches very well. He seldom ask students questions in class but he keeps talking very fast so that you need to pay attention.
reviews.comment_grading: The grade I got is good and I think this course only requires you some basic ideas in chemistry so that you don't need to worry about grade at all.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not too heavy, especially for students who have learnt chemistry before. Tests are easy to handle.

reviews.author: USTian
reviews.comment_content:
Not too difficult if you have taken chemistry class in high school before.
0. Measurement and Calculations in Chemistry
1. Chemical Foundations
2. Atomic Structure and Periodicity: many Qs were based on this chapter for the midterms.
3. Atoms to Molecules
4. Bonding - General Concepts
5. Molecular Structure and Orbitals: many short answer Qs were based on this chapter for the finals.
6. Chemical Energy
7. Gases
8. Liquids and Solids: did not have enough time to cover this topic.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Clear teaching with good pronunciation. May be a bit boring for some of the contents.
The professor uploads student version PPTs with blanks here and there, so that the students take notes & fill in blanks in the student version PPTs during the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
Online Quiz 1 - 10%
Midterm Exam - 40%
Online Quiz 2 - 10%
Final Exam - 40%

Online quizzes are done online with 2 hours of time given, so you could get full marks easily.
Midterm was all MCs, Final was MC + short answers, noncumulative. You have to know how to draw molecules for the finals.
I got 1.1 SD above mean on the midterm (mean = 66%), and 0.8 SD above mean on the final (mean = 61%), giving me an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
Only online quizzes are compulsory.
I worked on questions in the textbook that the professor suggested for each chapter, and it helped me understand the concepts clearly.

佢都會建議你睇書因為exam會出啲好類似既題目

同埋佢都好有耐性  不過唔太鐘意人地噪同講野

reviews.author: Kelvin
reviews.comment_content: The content is mostly aligned with chem1020, except the last 1-2 chapters skipped. This course is for students didn't study chem in their high school or who studied combined science in chemistry( I am the latter one).  The content is mostly irrelevant to the chem taught in high school as the first half (eg. orbital shapes) are from physics actually, but without the math. If you are interested in knowing the mathematical derivation of the orbital, I recommend phys2022(modern physics).
reviews.comment_teaching: I can feel that Professor is passionate in teaching, though his teaching is not fantastic, I would say, as his voice cannot attract the attention from students. Also I think he only teaches the content slides by slides without extra explanation or stories related to the content. This makes the lectures boring.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is quite good. May be one of the factor is that no students with solid background are in this class xd. I don't know the mean grade but I got an A here.
reviews.comment_workload: The only workloads are midterm and final. No hw or assignment. But this may make you lazy to keep yourself in the pace of lecture.

reviews.comment_content:

AL chemistry
mainly focus on orbital
不過對於我地呢啲中學冇讀過chem既有一定難度

reviews.comment_workload: no assignment

reviews.author: Spicylemon
reviews.title: Fair for a student with only basic understanding
reviews.comment_content:
Chapter Review: Measurement and Calculations in Chemistry
Chapter 1: Chemical Foundations
Chapter 2: Atomic Structure and Periodicity
Chapter 3: Bonding
Chapter 4: Molecular Structure and Orbitals
Chapter 5: Stoichiometry
Chapter 6: Types of Chemical Reactions and Solution Stoichiometry
Chapter 7: Chemical Energy

Dr Tsang provides powerpoint slides, though they are not all filled in and will require copying of notes into them. However, with the classes being called off in the middle of the year, those notes (full) were made available.
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr Tsand will go through PowerPoint slides while filling in the blanks that are present in the student's version. She will sometimes go into explaining the concepts, though it is mostly reading off the powerpoint. However, for students that do not have a strong background in different types of bond structures, this course will be very abstract and difficult to grasp. Strongly recommend only taking this course if absolutely necessary, as it is often frustrating as you will think you understand the concepts logic behind, until you were tested on it with a different angle which will catch you very offguard.
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair, and there is no biases as the grades all come from MCQs. Since We do not have final exams in a hall this year, the grades came from Canvas quizzes. Though they look simple, they are however a little tricky. Doing the textbook questions is highly recommended before taking the quizzes. However, the midterms were just alright.

0.5 above SD
Average 85% for quizzes
B+ in the end
reviews.comment_workload: Attending the lectures is compulsory as there are blanks in the powerpoints. However, some concepts might be confusing and abstract, and it will take quite some time and Youtube videos to grapse.

reviews.comment_content:
The contents are quite easy.


Chapter 1: Chemical Foundations

reviews.comment_teaching: Emily is the best professor in UST I have met. She explained all concepts clearly. Her notes were well-organised and very easy to understand. During the class, if you had any questions,   you could ask her immediately and she would explain it again. If you had any questions after the class, you could also ask her through email or zoom. If you were not good at English, she felt free to speak Cantonese to answer your questions. :)
reviews.comment_grading:
